Global Compact Human Rights Working Group

In June 2006, the Global Compact Board established a Global Compact Human Rights Working Group. Chaired by Mary Robinson, former UN High Commissioner for Human Rights and President of Ireland, the goal of the working group is to provide strategic input to the Global Compact’s human rights work.  While aiming to contribute to greater coherence, the working group helps define new areas of work that the Global Compact has a comparative advantage in advancing. It also helps to define new forms of learning and dialogue activities with a possible focus on the sectoral dimension of human rights. The working group also anticipates the involvement of the Global Compact’s extensive local network infrastructure.

  • Terms of Reference
  • List of Members

 

Workstreams

Human Rights and Business Case Studies Series – Embedding Human Rights in Business Practice (EHRBP)

The Editorial Board oversees production the case studies series, ‘Embedding Human Rights in Business Practice’, co-published by the UN Global Compact Office and the Office of the High Commissioner of Human Rights.  Among other things, the Editorial Board is responsible for approving case studies and providing peer review.  The 3rd volume of the publication will be available in September 2009. 

Case studies from the previous versions are available in Business Practices.

Good Practice Forum

In April 2008, the working group agreed to function as a forum for consideration of the endorsement of good business practices on human rights. Rather than highlighting specific practices of individual companies, good practice notes seek to identify general approaches that have been recognized by a number of companies as being good for business and good for human rights. The good practice notes in the following areas are proposed to be developed:

  • Concept note
  • Multistakeholder Panel
  • Corporate Human Rights Advocacy
  • Buyer Impacts on Labour Rights in the Supply Chain

Global Business Initiative on Human Rights (GBI)

The GBI, developed in collaboration with the Global Compact, is a direct legacy activity of the Business Leaders Initiative on Human Rights.  GBI concentrates on the practical implementation of human rights by business and maintains a culture of focused discussions between company members, drawing on human rights expertise.  The working group provides support to the GBI and feedback and input to its secretariat at regularly scheduled HRWG meetings.

Solutions Forum on Human Rights Dilemmas for Business

The UN Global Compact and Maplecroft, with support from the GE Foundation, have launched a dilemma-focused, multi-stakeholder solutions forum aimed at identifying good practices from different stakeholders’ perspectives in response to a number of dilemmas businesses face on human rights.  Regular updates are provided to the working group whose members are also invited to be active participants in the solutions forum.  At each working group meeting, over the 3 year period of the project, one or more dilemmas will be presented for input.  It is hoped that the solutions generated as a result of this project will feed into the good practice forum referred to above.

Human Rights Reporting

In recognition of the fact that human rights issues present unique challenges for reporting, a regular item on the agenda of the working group is the topic of human rights reporting.  In addition, the working group provides feedback on guidance materials, such as those developed by GRI, Realizing Rights and the UN Global Compact as part of the joint project "Human Rights Reporting: A Call to Action”. The guidance materials are developed to help companies with the human rights dimension of their communication on progress – the annual requirement of all Global Compact participating companies.

Corporate Culture and Values Project

This project seeks to better understand how corporate values and culture impact human rights decision-making and actions by businesses, so as to enhance the greater uptake and implementation of world-class corporate values and the positive impact contemplated by the Global Compact principles. Led by Chip Pitts, member of the Human Rights Working Group, this project is still in the development stage, but will begin by creating an inventory of stated formal corporate values.

Human Rights Day

In the last couple of years, the working group has included on its agenda the question of how to leverage Human Rights Day, which takes place annually on December 10th, to advance business and human rights.  In 2008, the 60th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the working group organized a CEO statement on the importance of human rights for business and collected signatures from CEO’s worldwide.

Global Compact Leaders Summit

To ensure that content on human rights is robust and effective as possible, the working group is taking an active role in the lead up to the Global Compact Leaders Summit (24-24 June 2009).
